data.title: Elections in Croatia
data.text:
Early Parliamentary Elections, 17 April 2024

Following an invitation to observe the upcoming early parliamentary elections in the Republic of Croatia scheduled for 17 April 2024, and in accordance with its mandate, ODIHR has deployed an Election Assessment Mission (EAM) for these elections. The mission will assess the elections for their

More info...

Parliamentary Elections, 5 July 2020

Following an invitation to observe the parliamentary elections scheduled for 5 July 2020, and in accordance with its mandate, ODIHR is planning to deploy an Election Assessment Mission (EAM) for these elections. The ODIHR EAM is planning to start its activities in Zagreb on 21 June 2020. The

More info...

Presidential Election, 22 December 2019

In accordance with its mandate and in anticipation of an official invitation to observe the 22 December 2019 presidential election in the Republic of Croatia, the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) undertook a Needs Assessment Mission (NAM) from 29 to 31 October 2019.

More info...

Parliamentary Elections, 8 November 2015

Following an official invitation to observe the parliamentary elections in Croatia, scheduled for 8 November 2015, based on the findings and conclusions of the Needs Assessment Mission deployed from 2 to 4 September 2015, and in accordance with its mandate, the OSCE/ODIHR has deployed an Election Assessment Mission (EAM) for these elections.

More info...

Parliamentary Elections, 4 December 2011

Following an invitation from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration of the Republic of Croatia to the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (OSCE/ODIHR), on 9 November 2011, the OSCE/ODIHR deployed a Limited Election Observation Mission (LEOM) for the 4 December 2011 parliamentary elections.

More info...
